New Records: David Fry hit the first go-ahead, pinch-hit home run in Cleveland Guardians franchise history.
Key Match Events: David Fry hit a momentum-shifting, series-saving home run into the Detroit Tigers' bullpen.
David Fry executed a squeeze bunt that allowed Brayan Rocchio to score a pivotal insurance run.
José Ramírez hit a home run, which was predicted by David Fry in a dugout conversation.
Pre-Game Insights: First-base coach Sandy Alomar Jr. recounted past heartbreaks and emphasized the need to 'plow the door down' instead of knocking.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Stephen Vogt praised David Fry's contributions, stating 'You just can’t say enough about what David has meant to us this year.'
Catcher Austin Hedges referred to the game as David Fry's 'coming-out party.'
Austin Hedges credited David Fry as a big reason for the team's current position.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rajai Davis, who attended every game of the series, reflected on his own postseason heroics and how they relate to Fry's performance.
